docs.title: Connectome Workbench
docs.description: Connectome Workbench is an open source, freely available visualization and discovery tool used to map neuroimaging data, especially data generated by the Human Connectome Project. The distribution includes wb_view, a GUI-based visualiation platform, and wb_command, a command-line program for performing a variety of algorithmic tasks using volume, surface, and grayordinate data. wb_command is necessary for running HCP data processing pipelines.

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: cifti-resample
docs.description:
Resample a cifti file to a new cifti space.

Resample cifti data to a different brainordinate space.  Use COLUMN for the direction to resample dscalar, dlabel, or dtseries.  Resampling both dimensions of a dconn requires running this command twice, once with COLUMN and once with ROW.  If you are resampling a dconn and your machine has a large amount of memory, you might consider using -cifti-resample-dconn-memory to avoid writing and rereading an intermediate file.  The <template-direction> argument should usually be COLUMN, as dtseries, dscalar, and dlabel all have brainordinates on that direction.  If spheres are not specified for a surface structure which exists in the cifti files, its data is copied without resampling or dilation.  Dilation is done with the 'nearest' method, and is done on <new-sphere> for surface data.  Volume components are padded before dilation so that dilation doesn't run into the edge of the component bounding box.  If neither -affine nor -warpfield are specified, the identity transform is assumed for the volume data.

The recommended resampling methods are ADAP_BARY_AREA and CUBIC (cubic spline), except for label data which should use ADAP_BARY_AREA and ENCLOSING_VOXEL.  Using ADAP_BARY_AREA requires specifying an area option to each used -*-spheres option.

The <volume-method> argument must be one of the following:

CUBIC
ENCLOSING_VOXEL
TRILINEAR

The <surface-method> argument must be one of the following:

ADAP_BARY_AREA
BARYCENTRIC

docs.title: cifti_in
docs.description: the cifti file to resample

docs.title: direction
docs.description: the direction of the input that should be resampled, ROW or COLUMN

docs.title: cifti_template
docs.description: a cifti file containing the cifti space to resample to

docs.title: template_direction
docs.description: the direction of the template to use as the resampling space, ROW or COLUMN

docs.title: surface_method
docs.description: specify a surface resampling method

docs.title: volume_method
docs.description: specify a volume interpolation method

docs.title: cifti_out
docs.description: the output cifti file

docs.title: opt_surface_largest
docs.description: use largest weight instead of weighted average or popularity when doing surface resampling

docs.title: volume_predilate
docs.description: dilate the volume components before resampling

docs.title: dilate_mm
docs.description: distance, in mm, to dilate

docs.title: opt_nearest
docs.description: use nearest value dilation

docs.title: weighted
docs.description: use weighted dilation (default)

docs.title: opt_exponent_exponent
docs.description: specify exponent in weighting function: exponent 'n' to use in (1 / (distance ^ n)) as the weighting function (default 7)

docs.title: opt_legacy_cutoff
docs.description: use v1.3.2 logic for the kernel cutoff

docs.title: weighted
docs.description: use weighted dilation (default)

docs.title: volume_predilate
docs.description: dilate the volume components before resampling

docs.title: surface_postdilate
docs.description: dilate the surface components after resampling

docs.title: dilate_mm
docs.description: distance, in mm, to dilate

docs.title: opt_nearest
docs.description: use nearest value dilation

docs.title: opt_linear
docs.description: use linear dilation

docs.title: weighted
docs.description: use weighted dilation (default for non-label data)

docs.title: opt_exponent_exponent
docs.description: specify exponent in weighting function: exponent 'n' to use in (area / (distance ^ n)) as the weighting function (default 6)

docs.title: opt_legacy_cutoff
docs.description: use v1.3.2 logic for the kernel cutoff

docs.title: weighted
docs.description: use weighted dilation (default for non-label data)

docs.title: surface_postdilate
docs.description: dilate the surface components after resampling

docs.title: affine
docs.description: use an affine transformation on the volume components

docs.title: affine_file
docs.description: the affine file to use

docs.title: flirt
docs.description: MUST be used if affine is a flirt affine

docs.title: source_volume
docs.description: the source volume used when generating the affine

docs.title: target_volume
docs.description: the target volume used when generating the affine

docs.title: flirt
docs.description: MUST be used if affine is a flirt affine

docs.title: affine
docs.description: use an affine transformation on the volume components

docs.title: warpfield
docs.description: use a warpfield on the volume components

docs.title: warpfield
docs.description: the warpfield to use

docs.title: opt_fnirt_source_volume
docs.description: MUST be used if using a fnirt warpfield: the source volume used when generating the warpfield

docs.title: warpfield
docs.description: use a warpfield on the volume components

docs.title: left_spheres
docs.description: specify spheres for left surface resampling

docs.title: current_sphere
docs.description: a sphere with the same mesh as the current left surface

docs.title: new_sphere
docs.description: a sphere with the new left mesh that is in register with the current sphere

docs.title: left_area_surfs
docs.description: specify left surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

docs.title: current_area
docs.description: a relevant left anatomical surface with current mesh

docs.title: new_area
docs.description: a relevant left anatomical surface with new mesh

docs.title: left_area_surfs
docs.description: specify left surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

docs.title: left_area_metrics
docs.description: specify left vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

docs.title: current_area
docs.description: a metric file with vertex areas for the current mesh

docs.title: new_area
docs.description: a metric file with vertex areas for the new mesh

docs.title: left_area_metrics
docs.description: specify left vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

docs.title: left_spheres
docs.description: specify spheres for left surface resampling

docs.title: cifti-resample
docs.description:
Resample a cifti file to a new cifti space.
